1.text: To everything there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heavens:

2.text: A time to be born, and a time to die; A time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;

3.text: A time to kill, and a time to heal; A time to break down, and a time to build up;

4.text: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; A time to mourn, and a time to dance;

5.text: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; A time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;

6.text: A time to seek, and a time to lose; A time to keep, and a time to cast away;

7.text: A time to rend, and a time to sew; A time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

8.text: A time to love, and a time to hate; A time of war, and a time of peace.

9.text: What profit hath he that worketh from that wherein he laboureth?

10.text: I have seen the travail that God hath given to the sons of men to toil in.

11.text: He hath made everything beautiful in its time; also he hath set the world in their heart, so that man findeth not out from the beginning to the end the work that God doeth.

12.text: I know that there is nothing good for them but to rejoice and to do well in their life;

13.text: yea also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy good in all his labour, it is the gift of God.

14.text: I know that whatever God doeth, it shall be for ever; there is nothing to be added to it, nor anything to be taken from it; and God doeth [it], that [men] should fear before him.

15.text: That which is was long ago, and that which is to be hath already been; and God bringeth back again that which is past.

16.text: And moreover I saw under the sun, that in the place of judgment, wickedness was there; and in the place of righteousness, wickedness was there.

17.text: I said in my heart, God will judge the righteous and the wicked; for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.

18.text: I said in my heart, It is thus with the children of men, that God may prove them, and that they should see that they themselves are but beasts.

19.text: For what befalleth the children of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other, and they have all one breath; and man hath no pre-eminence above the beast: for all is vanity.

20.text: All go unto one place: all are of the dust, and all return to dust.

21.text: Who knoweth the spirit of the children of men? Doth it go upwards? and the spirit of the beasts, doth it go downwards to the earth?

22.text: And I have seen that there is nothing better than that man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion; for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?
